summary: The Department of Defense tries to minimize costs by consolidating some services—such as IT or payroll—used by multiple DOD agencies. The Defense-Wide Working Capital Fund finances 3 agencies within DOD that charge their customers—including the military departments—when providing goods and services. We found the agencies set prices designed to recover their costs and break even. However, their largest customers said they don’t receive detailed information...
title: Defense Management: Defense-Wide Working Capital Fund Agencies Apply Most Key Operating Principles but Should Improve Pricing Transparency
